column4: how do i disable bluetoothd from starting automatically, my desktop doesn't have bluetooth
System / Admin / Services - uncheck Bluetooth device management
doesnt that disable it only in the current session?
in Services no - but i'd use use mickster04's suggestion - which might be current session only
then Services
x only for directories & executable files/scripts
cool, thanks
is Pulse running "ps aux | grep pulse" Pulse and Alsa are two different things!  Pulse uses ALSA.
it is running, but in sound preferences/applications it says the applications are using alsa
what version of Ubuntu are you using?  i don't see that in my 10.04 really.
and where exactly are you seeing alsa listed?
and then applications tab
mine just shows Rhythmbox with a volume control
now is shows Rhythmbox & Audacious with volume controls
yes, mine too, but doesnt it say ALSA in yours?
NO
what do you have as profile
in hardware
1 entry - Internal Audio 1 output / 1 Input Analog Stereo Duplex
ok, thankls
good luck man.
not if you want them both to work ;)
that would require some sort of 3rd party boot mechanism to select which to boot
